title: 806 people evacuated in Badulla due to landslide threat
byline: Badulla District Secretary Prabath Abeywardena says 806 residents from 238 families have been evacuated across the district due to the heightened risk of landslides triggered by the onset of the northeast monsoon.

title: Madueke double at Brugge helps Arsenal keep 100% record
byline: Noni Madueke scored twice as Arsenal beat Club Brugge to maintain their 100% record in the Champions League and all but secure their place in the knockout phase.

title: Insurance payouts kick off as Cyclone Ditwah leaves trail of destruction
byline: The insurance companies in Sri Lanka have mobilised swiftly to provide relief following the devastation caused by Cyclone Ditwah, with the authorities confirming that the compensation payments for minor property damage have already begun.

title: WTA signs with Mercedes in 'most significant deal in our history'
byline: The Women’s Tennis Association has announced a long-term partnership with Mercedes-Benz which has the potential to be the largest in women’s sport.

title: Smriti Mandhana makes first comment since wedding cancellation, ’don’t love anything more than cricket’
byline: Smriti Mandhana is well and truly back not only on the field and but also in the public eye after confirming that her wedding is called off. In an event, she came up with a statement stating that she doesn’t love anything more than cricket.

title: Former CBSL governor Cabraal ordered to pay Rs. 1.84 billion compensation, released on conditions
byline: Former Central Bank Governor Ajith Nivard Cabraal was released on conditions in connection with the Greek bond case, while the three other accused were released unconditionally by Colombo High Court Judge Mohammed Mihal yesterday.

title: Sri Lanka After Cyclone Ditwah: The Full Scale of the Disaster in Numbers
byline: Cyclone Ditwah left Sri Lanka facing a national disaster of extraordinary scale.

title: Officials face public pressure
byline: Officials involved in distributing relief and compensation in the aftermath of Cyclonic Storm Ditwah, which left severe destruction across Sri Lanka are increasingly coming under pressure from multiple fronts, Daily Mirror learns.

title: US seizes oil tanker off the coast of Venezuela, Trump says
byline: US forces have seized an oil tanker off the coast of Venezuela, President Donald Trump said, marking a sharp escalation in Washington’s pressure campaign against Nicolás Maduro’s government.

title: Search operations for the missing to continue
byline: Search operations at landslide sites will continue unless family members or relatives of those missing request otherwise, or the government takes a policy decision to discontinue them, an official said yesterday.

title: Trump launches $1m ’gold card’ immigration visas
byline: President Donald Trump has launched a scheme offering fast-tracked US visas to wealthy foreigners who can pay at least $1m (£750,000).

title: Excise officer arrested for allegedly soliciting Rs. 2 million bribe
byline: An Excise Sergeant attached to the Narcotics Bureau of the Excise Department was arrested by officers of the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) on charges of soliciting a bribe of Rs. 2 million.

title: Nuwara Eliya supermarket fined Rs. 500,000 for overpricing bottled water
byline: The Nuwara Eliya Magistrate’s Court has imposed a fine of Rs. 500,000 on a supermarket along Glenfall Road after it was found guilty of selling bottled drinking water at a price higher than the government-approved rate.

title: US drops bid to preserve FIFA bribery convictions
byline: The US government has moved to drop its case against a former Fox broadcasting executive involved in the FIFA corruption scandal that plunged the world’s footballing body into crisis.

title: Major rivers remain at normal levels; No flood threat detected
byline: All major rivers across the country are flowing at normal levels with no risk of minor or major flooding, according to the latest hydrology update issued at 6.30 a.m. today (11).

title: WTA signs with Mercedes in 'most significant deal in our history'
byline: The Women’s Tennis Association has announced a long-term partnership with Mercedes-Benz which has the potential to be the largest in women’s sport.

title: Smriti Mandhana makes first comment since wedding cancellation, 'don’t love anything more than cricket'
byline: Smriti Mandhana is well and truly back not only on the field and but also in the public eye after confirming that her wedding is called off. In an event, she came up with a statement stating that she doesn’t love anything more than cricket.

title: Germany extends €500,000 emergency assistance to Sri Lanka following cyclone Ditwah
byline: Germany has announced emergency aid worth approximately €500,000 to support Sri Lanka in the wake of the devastating impact of Cyclone Ditwah. The assistance has been provided under the European Union Civil Protection Mechanism (EU UCPM) as part of the collective EU emergency response.

title: Sri Lanka signs US$150 million World Bank deal to upgrade primary health care system
byline: The Government has signed a financial agreement with the International Development Association (IDA) of the World Bank Group to secure US$150 million for a nationwide project aimed at improving the primary health care system.

title: Cabinet approves fresh call for investment proposals for Kollupitiya land
byline: The Cabinet has approved a proposal to call for new investment proposals to lease a prime land plot in Kollupitiya, following the cancellation of a previous agreement due to non-compliance by the selected investor.

title: Cabinet approves two 50MW wind power projects in Mannar
byline: The Cabinet has approved the establishment of two new wind power plants each with a capacity of 50 megawatts in Mullikulum, Mannar, as part of the government’s push to generate 70% of Sri Lanka’s electricity from renewable energy by 2030.

title: Cabinet approves sale of Sri Lanka Railway Department scrap metal to highest bidders
byline: Cabinet approval has been granted to award the tender for the disposal of scrap metal held by the Sri Lanka Railway Department to the highest responsive bidders.

title: PHU tells President: Start talks with IMF for amending debt-restructuring plan
byline: Pivithuru Hela Urumaya (PHU) has put forward proposals in writing to President Anura Kumara Dissanayake for rebuilding the country.

title: AWC begins week-long veterinary support programme for animals in disaster shelters
byline: The Animal Welfare Committee (AWC) has launched a seven-day programme to deliver medical care, including rabies vaccinations, to animals staying in safety centres alongside people displaced by the recent adverse weather.

title: Met Department warns of thunderstorms and strong lightning in several districts
byline: The Meteorological Department has issued a warning of a high likelihood of thunderstorms accompanied by intense lightning in parts of the Kalutara, Ratnapura, Galle, and Matara districts.

title: Bribery Commission quizzes Gayantha Karunathilaka
byline: Opposition MP Gayantha Karunathilaka appeared before the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption this morning (11) to provide a statement regarding the leasing of a building in the Rajagiriya area for the functioning of the Ministry of Agriculture.

title: Ali Sabry says Cabraal case reflects fair, balanced use of new anti-corruption law
byline: The decision to release Former Central Bank Governor Ajith Nivard Cabraal from the Greek Bonds case, under strict conditions, reflects how Sri Lanka’s justice system is evolving under the new Anti-Corruption Act, Former Minister and President’s Counsel Ali Sabry said.

title: Western Province records highest number of dengue cases this week
byline: Health authorities warn of a sharp rise in dengue infections, with the Western Province reporting the highest number of cases this week, according to National Dengue Prevention Unit Director Dr. Kapila Kannangara.

title: 400 families in Matale warned to evacuate
byline: Some 400 families in the Matale District were today issued with fresh warnings by the National Building and Research Organisation to leave for safer locations due to the risk of earth slips and rock falls.

title: Daisy Forrest appears before JMO for mental evaluation ahead of trial
byline: Daisy Forrest, the grand-aunt of Yoshitha Rajapaksa — son of former President Mahinda Rajapaksa — appeared before the Colombo Judicial Medical Officer (JMO) today for an assessment of her mental fitness to stand trial.

title: AMS wants inquiry from Health Secretary over PSC appointment violation
byline: The Association of Medical Specialists (AMS) has called on the Secretary of the Ministry of Health to initiate an official inquiry into the incident at the Gampaha District General Hospital, where a PSC-appointed surgeon was prevented from assuming duties on December 10.

title: Case against Rajitha, two others to be taken up on January 29
byline: Colombo High Court Judge Mohammed Mihal today ordered that the case filed by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) against former Fisheries Minister Rajitha Senaratne and two other accused over alleged losses caused to the government during the 2014 leasing of the Modara Fisheries Harbour to a private company be taken up on January 29.

title: U.S. Under Secretary of State for Political Affairs Hooker to arrive today
byline: United States Under Secretary of State for Political Affairs, Allison Hooker will travel to Sri Lanka today (December 11).

title: Two Sri Lankan-Origin Stars in Australia U19 World Cup Squad
byline: Australia has named its squad for the ICC U19 World Cup 2026, with Nitesh Samuel and Naden Cooray, both of Sri Lankan origin, earning call-ups after stellar performances at the Under-19 National Championships.

title: Lionel Messi in India: Full GOAT Tour Schedule, Ticket Information and Programme Details for Sri Lankan Fans
byline: Lionel Messi is all set to arrive in Hyderabad on December 13 as part of his G.O.A.T India Tour 2025, creating massive excitement among football fans across the country.

title: Australia, UNFPA step in to protect women, girls after Ditwah
byline: Australia has partnered with the United Nations Population Fund (UNFPA) to deliver urgent humanitarian assistance aimed at protecting women and girls affected by the widespread floods and landslides triggered by Cyclone Ditwah — one of the most destructive climate disasters to impact Sri Lanka in recent years.

title: LGBTQ+ events to go ahead at World Cup game despite Egypt and Iran objections
byline: Plans to celebrate LGBTQ+ rights and freedoms in Seattle during the World Cup next summer will continue despite objections from the Egyptian and Iranian football federations over the “Pride Match” due to take place in the city.

title: Registrar General to issue death certificates for over 200 missing persons of Cyclone ‘Ditwah’
byline: The Registrar General’s Department said that death registration certificates will be issued for 203 individuals reported missing following the landslides and floods triggered by Cyclone Ditwah.

title: New compensation package to convince relocation from landslide zones – Minister
byline: Claiming that people in landslide prone areas have been reluctant to move out as the compensation was not sufficient, Environment Minister Dhammika Patabedi said yesterday the government was expecting that the people will now move out as a sufficient compensation package was proposed by the government.

title: Distribution of aid, compensation after Ditwah: Officials face public pressure
byline: Officials involved in distributing relief and compensation in the aftermath of Cyclonic Storm Ditwah, which left severe destruction across Sri Lanka are increasingly coming under pressure from multiple fronts, Daily Mirror learns.

title: US seizes oil tanker off the coast of Venezuela, Trump says
byline: US forces have seized an oil tanker off the coast of Venezuela, President Donald Trump said, marking a sharp escalation in Washington’s pressure campaign against Nicolás Maduro’s government.

title: Former Speaker Asoka Ranwala hospitalised after road accident in Sapugaskanda
byline: National People’s Power (NPP) MP and former Speaker Asoka Ranwala was hospitalised this evening following a road accident in the Sapugaskanda area, police said.

title: Three-day mobile vet clinic in Mannar to aid flood-hit farm animals
byline: The Government Veterinary Officers’ Association will launch a three-day mobile clinic in Mannar starting tomorrow to treat farm animals affected by the recent floods caused by Cyclone Dithwa, Association President Dr. Upul Ranjith Kumara said.

title: CEJ demands immediate halt to illegal clearing, construction in Knuckles conservation forest
byline: The Centre for Environmental Justice (CEJ) has sent a letter of demand to the Conservator General of Forests, calling for the immediate suspension of all illegal clearing and construction activities within the Knuckles Conservation Forest.

title: More than 30 dead after Myanmar military air strike hits hospital
byline: At least 34 people have died and dozens more are injured after air strikes from Myanmar’s military hit a hospital in the country’s west on Wednesday night, according to ground sources.

title: Diplomats donate salaries to Sri Lanka’s disaster relief
byline: Sri Lanka’s diplomatic community in Colombo has made a collective personal contribution of LKR 3.6 million to support the country’s disaster relief efforts, with several ambassadors donating from their own salaries to assist those affected by the recent earthquake.

title: Akbar Brothers wins overall award for Net Foreign Exchange Earner
byline: Akbar Brothers has won the overall award for Net Foreign Exchange Earner at the 27th Presidential Export Awards held at BMICH a short while ago.

title: Where does plantation community fit into government’s disaster relief matrix?: Mano
byline: Tamil Progressive Alliance (TPA) leader Mano Ganesan today took to the government’s disaster relief matrix and questioned how the plantation community fits into it.

title: Former Bolivian President Luis Arce arrested in corruption probe
byline: Bolivia’s former president, Luis Arce, has been arrested in La Paz as part of an investigation into alleged graft, the government has said.

title: ICC Men’s T20 World Cup 2026 tickets to go live today, prices start at ₹100 and LKR1000
byline: The International Cricket Council (ICC) today announced the opening of ticket sales for the ICC Men’s T20 World Cup, pricing entry-level tickets at historic lows to drive accessibility for the pinnacle event. Sales will begin at 18h45 IST with prices starting at just ₹100 (approximately $1.11) at some venues in India and LKR1000 (approximately $3.26) in Sri Lanka.

title: UN launches $35.3M humanitarian plan to assist Sri Lanka after Ditwah
byline: The United Nations and humanitarian partners have launched a Humanitarian Priorities Plan (HPP), seeking USD 35.3 million (LKR 10.9 billion) to scale up life-saving assistance for communities affected by Cyclone Ditwah in Sri Lanka.
